Dictionary.Name: The Free On-line Dictionary of Computing (27 SEP 03)

Definition.WordDefinition:
IDE
1. <storage> Integrated Drive Electronics, see {Advanced Technology Attachment}.
2. <programming, tool> {integrated development environment}.
3. <company> {Interactive Development Environments}.
(2002-04-14)

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Ide \Ide\, n. (Zo["o]l.) Same as first {Id}, the fish. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: -ide \-ide\ (Chem.) A suffix used to denote: (a) The nonmetallic, or negative, element or radical in a binary compound; as, oxide, sulphide, chloride. (b) A compound which is an anhydride; as, glycolide, phthalide. (c) Any one of a series of derivatives; as, indogenide, glucoside, etc. [1913 Webster]
